item.title: Report I-2024120027
item.description:
Report I-2024120027

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-12T12:24:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-04
  • City: Durham
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the unloading phase of trailer, employee was attempting to unload a pallet of freight with a forklift, the forklift blades were protruding past the pallet and punctured a box in front of the pallet. Contact was made at the bottom side of the box putting a 1/2 inch long puncture in the box that caused a puncture to the inner packaging. Inner packaging was then taken out placed in a position to where the material would not leak further. All spillage of material was confined to immediate area for cleanup

item.title: Report E-2024120174
item.description:
Report E-2024120174

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-11T12:32:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-10
  • City: CHINA GROVE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 10, 2024, one (1) 50-pound bag of sodium hydroxide was torn during loading and released approximately two (2) pounds of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Carolina Environmental Response Team, Inc. (CERT) to remediate the impacted site. CERT personnel utilized a HEPA vacuum to remove all product, then utilized cleaners and absorbents to further remediate the site. All waste was containerized in three (3) 35-gallon drums of and one (1) 15-gallol drum for disposal.

item.title: Report I-2024120024
item.description:
Report I-2024120024

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-10T12:24:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-04
  • City: DURHAM
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At the time of unloading, pallet of boxes was found crushed and three boxes leaking of material. The cause of the spillage was determined to be from top loaded freight that was too heavy. The material was confined to immediate area. The spill was mitigated from further release

item.description:

  • City: GREENSBORO
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: CALL WAS MADE TO THE DMP CAGE ABOUT A POSSIBLE LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE. DESIGNATED RESPONDER FOUND A PACKAGE WET FROM CONTENTS INSIDE THE PACKAGE. FOLLOWING ALL PROPER RESPONDER METHODS, THE PACKAGE WAS SECURED AND RETURNED TO THE DMP CAGE TO BE PROCESSED.
